intro: Eriospermum multifidum, commonly known as the multifidum eriosperm, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a short, hairy stem with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often deeply lobed. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a dense, daisy-like cluster, producing small, oval-shaped seeds. Eriospermum multifidum is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
